monumentInformation.title: Who Built It
details: The Colosseum was commissioned by Emperor Vespasian of the Flavian dynasty in 70-72 CE as a gift to the Roman people.
It was completed under Emperor Titus in 80 CE, with later modifications by his brother, Emperor Domitian.

monumentInformation.title: Where It Is Located
details: The Colosseum is located in the heart of Rome, Italy, just east of the Roman Forum.
It stands in the Piazza del Colosseo, symbolizing the grandeur of ancient Rome.

monumentInformation.title: When It Was Built
details: Construction of the Colosseum began in 70-72 CE during the reign of Emperor Vespasian.
It was completed in 80 CE, taking approximately 8 years to finish. Additional improvements were made under Emperor Domitian around 81-96 CE.

monumentInformation.title: Who Is It Protected By
details: The Colosseum was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1980, recognized for its historical and cultural importance.
It is protected and maintained by the Italian Ministry of Culture and various heritage organizations to ensure its preservation.

monumentInformation.title: Why It Was Built
details: The Colosseum was built as a massive amphitheater for public spectacles such as gladiator combats, animal hunts, and mock naval battles.
It served as a symbol of Rome's power, engineering brilliance, and the Flavian dynasty's generosity towards the Roman people.
